description: Retrieves all of the cost anomalies detected on your account during the time period that's specified by the DateInterval object. Anomalies are available for up to 90 days.

parameters.name: DateInterval
parameters.description: Assigns the start and end dates for retrieving cost anomalies. The returned anomaly object will have an AnomalyEndDate in the specified time range. The first date an anomaly was observed. EndDate (string) --- The last date an anomaly was observed.

nested_params.name: StartDate
nested_params.description: The first date an anomaly was observed.

nested_params.name: EndDate
nested_params.description: The last date an anomaly was observed.

parameters.name: TotalImpact
parameters.description: Filters anomaly results by the total impact field on the anomaly object. For example, you can filter anomalies GREATER_THAN 200.00 to retrieve anomalies, with an estimated dollar impact greater than 200. The comparing value that's used in the filter. The lower bound dollar value that's used in the filter. EndValue (float) --- The upper bound dollar value that's used in the filter.

nested_params.name: NumericOperator
nested_params.description: The comparing value that's used in the filter.

nested_params.name: StartValue
nested_params.description: The lower bound dollar value that's used in the filter.

nested_params.name: EndValue
nested_params.description: The upper bound dollar value that's used in the filter.

nested_items.name: Anomalies
nested_items.description: A list of cost anomalies.

nested_items.name: AnomalyId
nested_items.description: The unique identifier for the anomaly.

nested_items.name: AnomalyStartDate
nested_items.description: The first day the anomaly is detected.

nested_items.name: AnomalyEndDate
nested_items.description: The last day the anomaly is detected.

nested_items.name: DimensionValue
nested_items.description: The dimension for the anomaly (for example, an Amazon Web Services service in a service monitor).

nested_items.name: RootCauses
nested_items.description: The list of identified root causes for the anomaly.

nested_items.name: Service
nested_items.description: The Amazon Web Services service name that's associated with the cost anomaly.

nested_items.name: Region
nested_items.description: The Amazon Web Services Region that's associated with the cost anomaly.

nested_items.name: LinkedAccount
nested_items.description: The member account value that's associated with the cost anomaly.

nested_items.name: LinkedAccountName
nested_items.description: The member account name value that's associated with the cost anomaly.

nested_items.name: UsageType
nested_items.description: The UsageType value that's associated with the cost anomaly.

nested_items.name: Contribution
nested_items.description: The dollar amount that this root cause contributed to the anomaly's TotalImpact.

nested_items.name: AnomalyScore
nested_items.description: The latest and maximum score for the anomaly.

nested_items.name: MaxScore
nested_items.description: The maximum score that's observed during the AnomalyDateInterval.

nested_items.name: CurrentScore
nested_items.description: The last observed score.

nested_items.name: MaxImpact
nested_items.description: The maximum dollar value that's observed for an anomaly.

nested_items.name: TotalImpact
nested_items.description: The cumulative dollar difference between the total actual spend and total expected spend. It is calculated as TotalActualSpend - TotalExpectedSpend.

nested_items.name: TotalActualSpend
nested_items.description: The cumulative dollar amount that was actually spent during the anomaly.

nested_items.name: TotalExpectedSpend
nested_items.description: The cumulative dollar amount that was expected to be spent during the anomaly. It is calculated using advanced machine learning models to determine the typical spending pattern based on historical data for a customer.

nested_items.name: TotalImpactPercentage
nested_items.description: The cumulative percentage difference between the total actual spend and total expected spend. It is calculated as (TotalImpact / TotalExpectedSpend) * 100. When TotalExpectedSpend is zero, this field is omitted. Expected spend can be zero in situations such as when you start to use a service for the first time.

nested_items.name: MonitorArn
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) for the cost monitor that generated this anomaly.

nested_items.name: Feedback
nested_items.description: The feedback value.

nested_items.name: NextPageToken
nested_items.description: The token to retrieve the next set of results. Amazon Web Services provides the token when the response from a previous call has more results than the maximum page size.
